fields.description: As a user, I'd like to be able to drag and drop issues between different epics in portfolio live plan which would streamline my process when having to reorganize user stories to new parent epics without having to open each issue individually to do so.
fields.summary: Ability to drag and drop issues between different epics in portfolio live plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62074].
{panel}
h3. Problem definition

Users are able to attach images on transition screens. However in the *New issue view* when it comes to inserting them in the comments, the attachment icon *does not* appear on the comment panel, which could cause confusion, as shown in the image below:

*Old issue view:*

!Screen Shot 2020-02-20 at 16.40.29.png|thumbnail!

*New Issue view:*

!Screen Shot 2020-02-20 at 16.41.01.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Include the attachment icon on the comment panel, as shown in the image below. This will allow the user to easily insert images in comments.
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-20 at 16.43.47.png|thumbnail!
h3. Note
 * The Attachment button will only appear on a Transition screen when there are existing attachments in the ticket, however, there's no option to browse and upload the attachment by clicking on the "+ Browse" link from the drop-down of the Attachment button. Hence, the workaround is to add the system Attachments field to the transition screen.
 * To upload an attachment during a transition, click on the "browse" link on the Attachments field to upload a file or use the drag and drop functionality. When the file is uploaded and present on the Transition screen, the Attachment button will be visible and user can choose to embed the file by clicking on the Attachment button and select the file.
fields.summary: In the new issue view, Include the attachment icon on the attachment transition screen to make it more intuitive

fields.description:
When importing Trello cards using the [External System import client|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-trello-951386555.html], please consider to include the custom fields provided by the [Custom fields Power-up app|https://trello.com/power-ups/56d5e249a98895a9797bebb9/custom-fields].

Workaround: Use the [CSV export utility|https://help.trello.com/article/747-exporting-data-from-trello-1], and then [Import the CSV|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-data-from-a-csv-file/] in Jira
fields.summary: When importing Trello cards, include custom fields provided by the Power-up

fields.description:
h3. Actual behavior
At this time if there are any issues with the current user section then the user is prompted to give a retry with an error saying that the Token has expired and they need to retry the operation.

h3. Suggested behavior
It would be nice if Jira can improve those error handlings by request a new token by itself when the session has expired.
fields.summary: Improve XSRF error handling

fields.description:
Would be great to have the abillity to copy raw markdown text, or a new tab in editor where raw markdown can be written.

Now having a raw markdown text, user can paste it into the editor, and it will be converted and styled properly.
fields.summary: Allow to copy raw markdown text from editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The dropdown for selecting field option in Automation for Jira only provides the first 15 options and is not scrollable. This gives the user the idea that there are no further options available and only on searching the matching options are displayed. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Make the dropdown scrollable or provide the option to load more options if present in the dropdown.
h3. Workaround

Currently, you will need to search for the option if known to you to return the value.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to load all options for the field value dropdown in Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to associate an issue with a sprint from the issue view, if there are more than 10 sprints that have the same prefix name, such as TestSprint#1 to TestSprint#20, you can't find sprints that are ranked 11th and below based on the alphanumeric ordering.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 15 or more sprints with the same prefix name, for example, TestSprint#1 to TestSprint#15
 # Navigate to an issue, try to associate the issue to a sprint
 # When clicking on the *Sprint* field, it'll have a drop-down list and display up to 10 sprints, sorted based on alphanumeric, like this:
#* TestSprint#1
#* TestSprint#10
#* TestSprint#11
# Due to how the sprints are sorted, the TestSprint#3 will be ranked below 11th.
# Try searching for TestSprint#3 and no results will be shown.

h3. Expected Results
* Searching for the exact name "TestSprint#3" should show the sprint

h3. Actual Results
* It returns "No Matches Found".


h3. Workaround
* Just search for "3" and it should return somewhere in the drop down list.
fields.summary: Sprint drop down list can't search for 11th sprint and below despite defining the keyword

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Cannot export workflow from Jira settings as Workflow

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a workflow edit screen
 # Click "Export" > "Workflow"

h3. Expected Results
The workflow is exported

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown and the export doesn't start.
{noformat}
Unable to export workflow.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot export workflow from Jira settings as Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Jira project that is linked with a Slack channel, set the comment notification as "Create" and "Update"
# Post a comment
# In Slack, confirm that the notification is sent
# Return to Jira and edit the comment
# In Slack, the notification in 3 is updated
# Wait for one hour
# In Jira, edit the same comment

h3. Expected Results
The notification in 3 is updated again

h3. Actual Results
A new Slack notification is sent 

h3. Problem Definition
It is confusing for users that the behavior of the Slack update differs depending of the timing the action

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if admins have the ability to set either to:
* leave as-is
* trigger a new Slack notification for every updates
* don't trigger a new Slack notification and keep updating the first notification(3 of the above steps)
fields.summary: Ability to set the behavior of the comment update notification when integrating with Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tickets from Service Desk next-gen projects do not appear in the Assigned to me gadget because they don't have a resolution on it and the filter of the gadget is assigned = user and resolution = unresolved

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSD next-gen project
# Create a ticket and assign to you
# Create a dashboard and add the Assigned to me gadget

h3. Expected Results
Tickets assigned to you will be shown

h3. Actual Results
The JSD next-gen tickets will not appear

h3. Workaround
# Create a filter with assignee = user and status not in (Closed, Resolved)
# Save the filter
# Create a dashboard and add the Filter Results gadget
# Add the created filter above to it
fields.summary: JSD Next-Gen tickets do not show in the "Assigned To Me" gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving a ticket from a project to another one that has a custom field with a default value, it shows as None instead of the correct value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a default value for an issue type (Next-gen project).
 # Move an issue from another project.

h3. Expected Results

The default value will be selected, with no need to edit.

!Screenshot 2020-02-19_16-13-13-816.png|width=276,height=140!
h3. Actual Results

The value is None and the user must select the value.

!Screenshot 2020-02-19_16-12-41-449.png|width=463,height=34!
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Default value is not respected when moving a ticket
Add a Link that points to an external file

fields.description:
h1. UPDATE

*The internal bug is fixed, Open in Microsoft Excel should work now for jira.com domains.*
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to open a filtered query in an Excel sheet directly by using the "Open in Microsoft Excel" icon on the top right corner of the "Filter issues" page results in a blank pop-up with no info on it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a filter
 # Click on the Open in Microsoft Excel" icon

h3. Expected Results

The results of the filter opens in an Excel sheet
h3. Actual Results

a blank pop-up with no info on it
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

*There is an internal bug being fixed soon.*
fields.summary: "Open in Microsoft Excel" button on filters page doesn't work in case of old jira.com domain

fields.description: There isn't any Malware protection scanning mechanism available at the moment. It would be great to have a Malware protection mechanism to scan all the uploaded attachment.
fields.summary: Malware protection mechanism to scan all the uploaded attachment.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Video file jitters in Chrome (Version 80.0.3987.116 (Official Build) (64-bit)) browser while viewing it through Jira's new issue view. This affects NextGen issues as well

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # New issue view feature is turned on
 # Add an on-screen recording to any Jira issue in Classic/NextGen project
 # Open the attachment via new issue view from Chrome browser
 # The video preview isn't static but has jitters

h3. Expected Results
* Video to be previewed smoothly

h3. Actual Results
* Video file jitters

Unable to scroll smoothly
h3. Workaround 
 * Switching to *Old issue view* via <Instance URL>/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
 ** Turning off Jira Labs.
* For NextGen to include the following at the end of the issue URL:
** https://<cloud_URL>/browse/<Issue-KEY>?oldIssueView=true
fields.summary: Video file jitters in Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an emoji is updated in a Jira issue with multiple emojis, the HTML email notification triggered shows all the emojis are updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with a description having bulleted emojis (as shown in the screenshot)
# Update one of the emojis > Save
# The email notification received shows that all the emojis are updated with a green box next to all the emojis 

h3. Expected Results
Email notification should show only the updated emoji 

h3. Actual Results
All the emojis shows as updated in the notification


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Email notification reports incorrect changes when emojis are updated in issues

fields.description: Currently, users unable to associate multiple workflows in business projects.  This option is available for software projects. I think these options have to be available for business project users too.
fields.summary: User should be able to associate multiples workflows in the business projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When calling a REST API endpoint in Jira to populate a user picker field using the POST method, Jira will not be able to find the users based on Atlassian Account ID.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send a POST REST call to Jira, For example, [transition issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-transitions-post]
# Add a field (user picker field) to be updated in the body of the REST call.
# Add Atlassian Account ID of a user as the value
#* Tested with Emails as well.

h3. Expected Results
* The user picker field should be updated with the user.

h3. Actual Results
* Jira couldn't get the user and the field will remain empty.

h3. Additional Scenarios
Using the same endpoint for the Assignee field, when the Assignee field has a user (User A) already, calling a REST API to update the Assignee field with a new user (User B) will remove the original user (User A) and the issue will be unassigned.
fields.summary: REST API endpoints can't fetch users based on Atlassian Account ID

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a business board, when you have *Assigned to me* quick filter applied, opening and closing the issue detail view of an issue will cause the issue to disappear from the board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a business board
 # Click the *Assigned to me* quick filter
 # Clicking on an issue will pop up the issue detail view
 # Close the issue detail view and the issue will disappear

Video reproducing the behavior: https://share.getcloudapp.com/nOuNYgLr

h3. Expected Results
* The issue detail view closes and the issue remains on the board

h3. Actual Results
* The issue disappears from the board

h3. Workaround
* Refresh the page and the issue will reappear. 
* Don't apply the *Assigned to me* quick filter
fields.summary: Opening and closing issue view on Business board causes the issue to disappear

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to paste the attachment from clipboard during a transition, the attachment is not uploaded.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue and make a transition (make sure the transition contains screen to allow the attachment of files)
# Attempt to add an image Copy an image from local machine
# Ctrl + V to paste image on comment

h3. Expected Results
The image is uploaded and the wiki markup of the attachments is automatically added to the comment.

h3. Actual Results
* The image is not uploaded 

h3. Notes
* Cannot add attachments with drag-and-drop functionality
* Cannot add attachments with manual insert functionality (*Browse* menu does not show up)
* Able to add attachments to +Create issue+ screen
* Able to add attachments to +View issue+ screen
* Able to add attachments to the comment window

No errors found in the browser console or server side

h3. Workaround
Add the attachments on View Issue screen, then only transition the issue.
fields.summary: Cannot Upload Attachments on Issue Transition Screens

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Derived from previous JRACLOUD-34423 - There are times when a Jira admin might need to create a large number of issues and choose to use the REST API as a means to do this. However you don't always want to send out notifications to all the users in the notification scheme when this takes place. It would be very helpful if the issue create endpoint api/2/issue had a means to do this, much like the edit issue endpoint (api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey} endpoint) has the notifyUsers query parameter.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the notifyUsers query parameter on the issue create endpoint as well.
h3. Why this is important

End users are easily annoyed by bulk issue creation. Many users have complained about Jira being overly chatty when it comes to email. This suggested solution would provide Jira admins a quick means to create issues without flooding the inbox of everyone on your team. This implementation method would still log issue histories and trigger other events/listeners just like notifyUsers currently works on api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey} endpoint.   The workaround can provide a solution, but it's not ideal because it is not granular enough to only limit notifications for this REST API call, it's overkill to completely change the notification scheme for this single issue creation event, and likely to leave the admin to forget to change it back.
h3. Workaround

It is possible for Jira admin to temporarily modify the notification scheme in use for that project so that no users are sent out notifications for such events as Issue Created, issue assigned, etc. However this work-around is not ideal as it prevents all such notifications for any project using that scheme.
fields.summary: REST API issue create endpoint should have the ability to suppress notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Business Projects when you click on an issue in the board and then click out, the assignee picture will vanish on that ticket and all unassigned issues will get that picture.

If you refresh the page it will get back to normal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Business Project;
 # Create an issue and choose an assignee;
 # Create an issue and leave unassigned;
 # Open the assigned issue;
 # Close the assigned issue.

Video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQugpPkA
h3. Expected Results

The assignee picture doesn’t vanish.
h3. Actual Results

The assignee picture vanishes and the unassigned get that picture.
h3. Workaround

Create a Software Project and migrate your issues to this new project.
fields.summary: Assignee Picture Vanishes From The Board When Clicking Out Of An Issue

fields.description: Just like we have in confluence when more than a single user is editing a page, it would be great if simultaneous issue updates could be displayed in real-time on the issue before saving it, avoiding the overwrite and data loss when saving the issue updates.
fields.summary: Sync issue updates simultaneously

fields.description: In classic projects, we can copy boards, it would be useful to have the same feature for Next-gen boards.
fields.summary: Copy/Duplicate Next-gen board

fields.description: We would like to be able to run a command within slack for example /tickets and it will use a filter from Jira and supply how many tickets created today V how many closed as well as how many tickets in each status.
fields.summary: Slack integration - Slack Command to show count of tickets in a project group by status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
notice on the custom fields, if you choose applicable issue types by selecting just a few of them, they are not rendered as icons on the context for the custom field. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your Jira Settings > Issues > Custom fields
# select a custom field and click on "Add context"
# Make the Applicable context for selected issue type.

h3. Expected Results
The Icons of the selected Issue type should be shown

h3. Actual Results
The Issue type shows as blank

 | !context config.jpg|thumbnail! ||!context.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: custom field context doesn't render the icon for issue types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Activity Stream gadget only displays "Anonymous User" whenever a reporter/assignee is changed.
*  !image-2020-02-18-13-23-06-379.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Activity Stream gadget on your dashboard
 # Change the assignee/reporter for the issue
 # Refresh the dashboard and check the activity where you change the assignee/reporter

h3. Expected Results
* The user's name should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
* The user's name will be displayed as "Anonymous User"


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Activity Stream is showing "Anonymous User" when the reporter/assignee is changed

fields.description:
When looking at the Atlassian documentation for search syntax for text fields, the behaviour of the product does not work as expected.
 [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/search-syntax-for-text-fields/] 

In our Jira instance, we would like the ability search for phrases such "never show" where, these words appear in sequence. The actual result is that every ticket that we ever created that have these two words return in the search results, so instead of isolating the search to a few tickets we are left to filter through hundreds or thousands of tickets. 

Similarly, searching for "some-text", the hyphen is treated as a space and the results return every ticket ever created with these two words in any order.

Considering the money we are spending with Atlassian, we would very much like this basic search functionality added to the product to enable us to more easily locate tickets from the past based on the above criteria, without having to purchase a plug-in.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud needs better search capabilities.

fields.description:
The problem with JIRA macOS app is that you can’t view the tickets when they have sub tasks, instead it just expands or collapses the subtask.

It would be great to have swimlanes feature in the app.
fields.summary: Support for subtasks swimlanes on Jira Cloud for Mac app

fields.description:
h3. Summary.

The "Add watchers" screen won't load properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the *Old issue view*, click on the meatballs menu *...* > *Watchers*

h3. Expected Results

The page loads and you'll be able to add watchers to the ticket.

h3. Actual Results
The following screen is loaded: 

 !image-2020-02-17-12-55-29-095.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Add watchers right from the new issue view
 !image-2020-02-17-12-56-05-026.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to add watchers from the "Add watchers" screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an inline issue in the backlog, the custom icons for issue types are distorted

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a custom icon on an issue type;
# Navigate to the backlog of a software project;
# When creating an inline issue, click the issue type icon to change the issue type.

h3. Expected Results
The custom icon for a given issue type is correctly shown.

 !Screen Shot 2020-02-17 at 12.09.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The custom icon for a given issue type is distorted.

 !Screen Shot 2020-02-17 at 12.09.42.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When creating an inline issue in the backlog, the custom icons for issue types are distorted

fields.description: This goes double when there are many if conditions and if/else conditions in larger rules.
fields.summary: The Audit log can be confusing and misleading when trying to check IF/ELSE conditions and blocks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For a Jira instance integrated with tempo and slack, searching for tempo account id field values while setting up JQL for slack integration will only retrieve 15 values.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install slack and try to integrate it with any of your project that is connected with Tempo as well. Make sure the tempo data has some relevant info and have at least 16 *Accounts* associated with it
 # During integration, under *FOR ISSUES THAT MATCH THIS FILTER,* type *account =* 
 # A list will appear that will show only 15 options under it and not the complete list.
 # The same is applicable for the assignee and many other custom fields.

h3. Expected Results

The full result should show up.
h3. Actual Results

Only 15 values are showing up.
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete doesn't filter based on the values you enter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a scheduled rule with multiple issues, Automation rule for releasing versions can cause it to create duplicate version when it is not suppose to.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation rule like below
 !version.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The Rule should trigger and no duplication should occur as specified here on [*version*|https://docs.automationforjira.com/reference/actions.html#create-version]
h3. Actual Results

In some instances, due to race condition, duplicate versions are created. This *rarely* happens, but with some conditions of running multiple automations, this is likely to occur, which presents an inconsistent behaviour to the Automation rule.
 !strange_behaviour.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

If you do notice the duplication, just delete it from the "Release" tab.
fields.summary: Concurrent executions of a scheduled rule can cause the Version Release with Automation for Jira to create duplicate Versions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The membersOf function in JQL is expected to show existing groups.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a JQL search, start typing assignee in membersOf(
 # It is desirable, that Jira automatically suggests the existing groups.

h3. Expected Results
 It is desirable, that Jira automatically suggests the existing groups.
h3. Actual Results
Jira suggests only individual users. 
 !image-2020-02-14-17-42-31-183.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Manually entering of groups.
fields.summary: JQL MembersOf Autocomplete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new issue view uses a different text editor, it is missing some formatting options available on the old issue view text editor.

Please implement the missing formatting options for the new issue view text editor.
h3. Old issue view text editor

!Screen Shot 2020-02-14 at 19.40.54.png|thumbnail!
h3. New issue view text editor

!Screen Shot 2020-02-14 at 19.41.26.png|thumbnail!
h3. Missing formatting options
 * Paragraph
 * Preformatted
 * Paragraph quote
fields.summary: New issue view editor missing formatting options.

fields.description:
The problem
-----------

Integration points for web items already exist in the dashboard page:
 - "gadgets.dashboard.menu"
 - "gadgets.dashboard.tools.menu"
 
Web items can be added here to open a dialog that performs operations (i.e. data export) on the dashboard as a whole.

At the moment, it is impossible to access the dashboard ID from this dialog context so the dashboard page integration points mentioned above have VERY limited use.

Suggested solution
------------------

Make the dashboard ID accessible as standard context parameters (https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/context-parameters/) not just for Dashboard Item modules but also for Dialog modules.

-------------------

Lack of this capability has been preventing us to deliver key feature(s) in our Better PDF Exporter for Jira Cloud app, which would be critical to help our Server customers migrate to Cloud. In addition to existing Server customers, we are also receiving support requests from potential customers already on Cloud asking for similar features that we have on Server.

In the first 8 months of our cloud app version, it gained traction of 700+ installations but we believe this pace (and server to cloud migration) could be faster through this suggestion.  

Improvements described in this issue would help us greatly in offering Server customers the same useful features on Cloud that they are accustomed to as well as provide a first-class experience to Cloud customers who discover the app for the first time.
fields.summary: Make dashboard ID accessible as a context parameter from dialog modules

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a new mail server (let's call it A)
 # Create a mail handler for project X (Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue) pointing to the new mail server A
 # Create another mail handler for project Y (Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue) pointing to Jira's default mail server
 # Send an email to the respective email address in order to create a new issue in project X
 # Trigger any notification on the issue that was just created to your user email address
 # Forward that email to the correspondent email of the mail handler responsible for creating issues in project Y

h3. Expected results

A new issue should be created in project Y
h3. Actual result

A new comment is made in the issue created previously in project X
h3. Workaround

Remove the issue key from the subject of the email before sending it
fields.summary: The wrong mail handler may process a forwarded jira notification message even though it does not correspond to the mail server the forwarding was sent to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is an inconsistency in user experience when a Filter subscription is being created. Time Zone that will be used for the new Filter subscription is indicated in case of “Daily”, “Days per Week” and “Days per Month” options, but not in case of “Advanced”.

!Filter subscription - Daily.png|thumbnail!
!Filter subscription - Advanced.png|thumbnail!

Discussed in Slack: https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CFGMKF5QC/p1581511232009300


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Start creating a Filter subscription by clicking on Details -> New subscription on a filter details page.

h3. Expected Results

Time zone is indicated for all options.
h3. Actual Results

Time Zone is not indicated for the Advanced option.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Time Zone that will be used for a Filter subscription should be indicated in case of Advanced option too

fields.description:
There should be a function to disable the introduction questions for new users. For some organizations, this information is not useful.

!image-2020-02-14-19-22-19-197.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Disable introduction questions for new users

fields.description:
Customers would like to have an option to opt out Automated Cloud/feature Updates.
Or there should be a consent requested from the customer to check if they would be willing to update their Jira Cloud with the latest Cloud updates.
fields.summary: Option to opt out from Automated Cloud/feature Updates.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to set “single user-User Picker” custom field in POST function for Issue Custom Field	with Current Field Value 
“%%CURRENT_USER%%”

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with single user-User Picker.
 # Navigate to Workflow >> Post Function
 # Add “Update Issue Custom Field” and choose the custom field created. 
# Assign Custom Field Value %%CURRENT_USER%%

h3. Expected Results

The post function should get added to the workflow. 

h3. Actual Results

Something went wrong
Error type: 500 - Internal server error
Log reference: “*****”

h3. Workaround

Use a “User Picker (multiple users)” custom field.
fields.summary: Unable to set “single user-User Picker” custom field in POST function for Issue Custom Field	with Current Field Value  “%%CURRENT_USER%%”

fields.description: Ability to have the Shortcut bar closed bye default opening Jira
fields.summary: Ability to have the Shortcut bar closed bye default opening Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A [ character breaks rendering if you tag a user afterwards. Preview shows expected, but rendering breaks on-save. noformat also affected

h3. Steps to Reproduce

[Here is a video reproducing the behavior|https://share.getcloudapp.com/wbumZy0O].

h3. Expected Results

All the text is displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The open bracket text is erased. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A [ character breaks rendering if you tag a user afterwards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Labels* field cannot be edited in the new Jira issue view, this is applicable for editing labels and creating new labels.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the new view, open an Issue and go to the *Labels* field
# Edit the field by clicking on it

h3. Expected Results

The field becomes editable.

h3. Actual Results

The field is un-editable with the appearance of a read-only field. If you try to use the "l" shortcut for editing labels, any changes made cannot be saved.

h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to switch to the old Jira issue view by clicking on the *See the old view* banner to edit the *Labels* field.
fields.summary: Unable to edit the Labels field in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the 2-dimensional gadget order the columns (X-axis) using the alphabetic order. So, as your field option use letters and not numbers, it will order by the first letter. In your case, April will be the first one as it starts with A, followed by December (D) and so on, and this order cannot be changes

h3. Suggested Solution

As a Jira user, I want to be able to manually sort the columns, or use different sorting criteria.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to sort items in the 2-dimensional dashboard gadget

fields.description:
I recently spent 10 minutes trying to find a ticket on my company's Jira server. I knew that it was recently created, so I went to the 
issues list (/projects/<prefix>/issues/) and changed the sort order to "created". 

 

What I expected:

The most recently created order is at the top of the list. 

 

What happened:

Since Jira currently maintains the selected ticket index, and the first ticket in the list is pre-selected when loading the issues list, the paginator swiched to the page which now contained the issue which was at the top of the list before changing sort order.

Since the only indication of the current page is the small paginator at the bottom of the screen, I didn't notice that I wasn't on page 1 (since the view loaded onto page 1, I assumed that it would still be there) and was left wondering where my new tickets went. After a while looking around, I was finally able to notice that I wasn't on the first page. Many clicks later (since I ended up on page 8) I was finally able to navigate back to page 1 to find my issue.

My suggestion:

When the user changes the "order by" drop-down on the issues page, the paginator should switch back to page 1, and the selection should the new "top" issue.
fields.summary: Issue Browsing -- Changing ticket order should reset page to 1

fields.description:
As a JIRA administrator,

I'd like to be able to disable the creation of new statuses by standard users through the Simplified Workflow's 'Add Status' button

so that I can:
 * avoid the creation of effectively duplicated status names like "To Do" & "TODO", or Testing & Test & Tested & In Test & Integration Test
 * make easier multi-project JQL queries to retrieve meaningful info based on statuses
 * make more maintainable the order in which statuses are displayed in gadgets and JQL ORDER BY clause.
 * avoid the creation of statuses for trying to store info when it would be better to use anything else instead (labels, the resolution field, a custom field...)
fields.summary: Prevent user creation of new statuses

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
 * Field type "Participants of an issue" is not available on the Issue view. The *Participants* field is a calculated custom field, meaning that users are not expected to edit it - instead it derives its value automatically from: reporter, current assignee and all commenters of the issue. ([Documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/custom-fields-types-in-classic-projects/])

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create a new custom field of type "Participants of an issue"
 - Associate that custom field to a screens
 - Create an issue and set some values while creating the issue on the custom field.
 - View the Issue after creation and the custom field is not present on the *new issue view.*
 - switch to the *old issue view* and the custom field is visible.{panel}
h3. *Expected Result*
 * Custom field should be displayed on the new issue view

h3. *Actual Result*
 * Custom field is not visible on the new issue view

h3. *Work Around*
 * View the issue in the Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Field type "Participants of an issue" not available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Allow user to manage watchers on a separate screen
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a screen with the list of watchers and a field to add new ones
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Allow user to manage watchers on a separate screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when the user are typing a long comment in the new issue view , they can't view the "Description" field. For example the screenshot below :-

 !Screenshot 2020-02-12 at 5.18.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the page longer so that the user able to view the "Description" field.

h3. Why this is important
It makes the user easier to review back the issue description.

h3. Workaround 
Use old issue view
fields.summary: Ability to view the "Description" field while adding a long comment in the "New Issue View"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently People Directory only show 6 people.

h3. Suggested Solution

Show all the people that the user "work with" or all the members in the same Team.
fields.summary: Show more than 6 people in People Directory

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 21 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

The Automatic option is now available in the assignee user picker in the new issue view. 

Thanks

Tha Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
Currently, there is no "Automatic" option in assignee user picker even though there is in the old issue view.
 It would be nice to user can choose "Automatic" option like the old issue view.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-02-12 12.15.53.png|width=502,height=208!

It's useful for the user who uses "components".
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/organizing-work-with-components-764478279.html]
fields.summary: Add the "Automatic" option to assignee user picker in the new issue view

fields.description: Ability to disable system add-ons from Jira
fields.summary: Ability to disable system add-ons from Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While using a screenreader (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, NVDA) to have a voice over for on screen text, flag notifications cause the text "Flag notifications" to be read which can cause confusion to users who rely upon such accessibility tools.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use a screen reader
 # Create an issue
 # Observe that the screen reader reads out the "Flag notifications" text as opposed to just the text in the flag notification

h3. Expected Results
Only the text in the notification is read.

h3. Actual Results
The text "Flag notifications" is read.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Flag notifications cause screen reader to read "Flag notifications"

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior
Currently there's no way for users to disable the feedback messages from Jira.
 !image-2020-02-11-17-37-22-135.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behavior
To have the option to opt-out or opt-in such messages in Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to opt-out Jira's feedback messages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user two users with the same name are assigned to a role as a default member, you will trigger an error while trying to edit the member list, and therefore cannot remove/edit the user from the list.

h3. Environment

Project roles page (YourInstance.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjectRoles.jspa)

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Access the project roles page
# Select *Manage Default Members* for any role (In My Example test2 role)
# Select *Edit* for Default Users
# Add two users with the same name
# Return to Admin >> System >> Roles >> The Role You added user to >> Manage Default Members >> edit

h3. Expected results

You should be able to see the default users and manage the list.

h3. Actual result

The error below is thrown and you can't edit the default members:
{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.VelocityException: Invocation of method 'getUserPickerHtml' in  class com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.roles.UserRoleActorAction threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.projectroleactors:atlassian-user-role-actor-action//templates/plugins/jira/projectroles/user-role-actor.vm[line 21, column 9]
	at com.atlassian.velocity.JiraVelocityManager.writeEncodedBodyImpl(JiraVelocityManager.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.velocity.JiraVelocityManager.writeEncodedBody(JiraVelocityManager.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.toWriterImpl(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:127)
Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getUserPickerHtml' in  class com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.roles.UserRoleActorAction threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.projectroleactors:atlassian-user-role-actor-action//templates/plugins/jira/projectroles/user-role-actor.vm[line 21, column 9]
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.text.RuleBasedCollator.compare(RuleBasedCollator.java:357)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.component.multiuserpicker.UserBean$UserBeanComparator.compare(UserBean.java:199)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.component.multiuserpicker.UserBean$UserBeanComparator.compare(UserBean.java:171)
{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2020-02-11 at 16.43.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Requires Database access. So, JIRA Cloud users file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com and reference this bug.
fields.summary: Cannot edit Default members of a role if two users with same name are added

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, sometimes it is not necessary to have the add-on users to be displayed in all User Picker fields. So I would like to have the ability to choose when and where these users should be displayed.
fields.summary: Allow the ability to choose if add-ons users should be displayed in User Picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when user adding comment in the new issue view and go to the next line, the formatting added an extra line. 

Adding comments from the old issue view will not add extra line.

 !Screenshot 2020-02-11 at 2.47.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the extra line from the comment template.

h3. Why this is important
The format looks not clean because it has an extra line.

h3. Workaround 
Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Remove extra line from the comment field in the new issue view

fields.description:
Hi,

we`re at the point that we need to compare the original estimate and the actual one. 

In Portfolio we dont have this data so we cannot take decisions based on these factors as we do in the Kanban board reporting.

What do you guys think about adding theses fields on portfolio?

 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add Spent Hours and Updated end date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Invitation email sent to users as a result of inviting them into an instance doesn't render the name of user properly if they have Umlauts characters .e.g Gößmann

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Subscribe to an instance https://www.atlassian.com/try/cloud/signup?bundle=jira-software&edition=free
 # Have a user who has Umlauts in their name
# Invite that user into your instance.

h3. Expected Results
Upon receiving the email, the Umlauts is rendered properly

h3. Actual Results

Upon receiving the email, there's an inconsistent behaviour, sometimes the Umlauts is rendered, sometimes it is not rendered properly and show somewhat unicode characters and at other times it's not rendered at all the entire Name of the invited user.


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Umlauts not correctly displayed in invitation emails

fields.description:
There is a section that shows "Who's Looking?" at the ticket. In the old issue view it would show other users looking at the ticket without an extra click, but in the new issue view, we have to click on "Open Who's Looking?" to see other users.

Should have another way in UI to see looking users without that extra click.
fields.summary: "Who's Looking?" requires extra click in the new issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When specifying a date (e.g., *11/02/2020*) in a date picker while creating a request in the portal results in the calendar setting the date incorrectly (e.g., *November 2, 2020*) even though the format is set to be *dd/MM/yyyy* and *%d/%m/%Y* in *Advanced settings*. When selecting a date in the calendar, it shows as *11/02/2020*, but the correct date of *February 11, 2020* is shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Advanced settings*
 # Set *jira.date.picker.java.format* to *dd/MM/yyyy*
 # Set *jira.date.picker.javascript.format* to *%d/%m/%Y*

h3. Expected Results
The inputted text should be read as day/month/year.

h3. Actual Results
The inputted text is read as month/day/year.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Manually typing date in date picker on portal can result in incorrect date

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Jira using Chrome
# In Japanese [IME|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method], type "kyouto" and select "京都" from the quick search

h3. Expected Results
"京都" gets confirmed and the focus stays there waiting for further input

h3. Actual Results
"京都" gets confirmed and the search is triggered
 
h3. Notes
* This happens in macOS 10.14.6 using Chrome

h3. Workaround
* Try using Firefox
fields.summary: When using IME, quick search is triggered upon the Enter key to confirm the character

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- When an email consists of multiple mail servers (project email address) in the recipient's list. It will create an issue in each of the projects respectively. _Eg: 3 mail servers, 3 issues will be created with the same subject
- Replying to the above email will result in 3 identical comments to be added in the first Jira issue key of the subject.

h3. Suggested Solution
- Ability to add comment in all the issue that was created in the initial email
fields.summary: Ability to add comment in all issues that was created through incoming mail

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*:

Currently, all columns of the Next-gen board are in grey color. Please enable the functionality to change the board column color.

*Suggested Solution*:

It would be good if we can enable the possibility to set different colors for the different columns in the Next-gen Board overview.
fields.summary: Enable the functionality to change the Next-gen board column color.

fields.description:
The *View issue* button is not keyboard accessible when using a screenreader.

Strikethrough text (e.g., when a ticket is unassigned from user and assigned to another) is not communicated for context.

Users who rely on screen reader software (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, and NDVA) are not properly communicating data for voice over functionality.
fields.summary: Accessibility issues with Jira notifications

fields.description:
When using the *Assignee* drop-down, the field doesn't communicate the full list of options available when using screen reader. The drop down list does not function when using IE at all (e.g., when using JAWS 2020, the list does not populate correctly).

When using a drop down-list on the portal, it doesn't work with JAWS 2020, JAWS 2018, and NVDA screen readers using either Chrome or Internet Explorer. The focus does not remain in the drop-down box. The user is not communicated what the form field is.

This is inhibiting users who rely on screenreader software for voice over technology (including VoiceOver for MacOS).
fields.summary: Using accessibility options to read text from dropdown boxes not working correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 In the Old Issue View having the permission to assign issues does not allow users to do it if they are not granted to Edit Issue Permission as well. In the New Issue View, it works properly. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Allow one user to *Assign Issues* 
 # Disable the same user to *Edit Issues*
 # Browse any tasks of the project in New Issue View and the user can change the assignee.  
 # Switch to Old Issue View and now the assignee field is disabled.

h3. Expected Results

In the old issue view users with the *Assign Issue* permission should be able to edit the assignee. 
h3. Actual Results

The field is locked.

!image-2020-02-06-11-35-35-603.png|thumbnail!

!image-2020-02-06-11-36-02-639.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

To work in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Assign Issue Permission does not work on Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Mobile approval not working without a valid request type


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access via Jira App a ticket which is pending your approval.
# Click on *Approve* or *Decline*.

h3. Expected Results
The ticket should be either approved or rejected.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is shown:
{quote}
 Unable to submit a response
{quote}

h3. Notes
Tested on iOS.
 
h3. Workaround
* Set a valid request type for the ticket.
* Approve the request using the mobile browser.
fields.summary: Mobile approval is not working without a valid request type

fields.description:
listen guys, I'm sure JQL is awesome but NOBODY KNOWS HOW TO USE IT. you should have an online docs. something SIMPLE a REFERENCE like all languages.... you know those languages, right? like SQL. WHY IS IT SO HARD TO LOOK FOR THIS : 

all items that contain a word

AND are of certain status (say not in ("Ready for QA")

AND of type = Bug? 

 

I spent 15 minutes now browsing google and couldnt find a god damn simple docs only medium blogs of people with amazing sophisticated examples. jesus. a simple reference doc!! not so hard!!!

 

 

sorry about the language. but your product really sucks. it does. I'm sorry.
fields.summary: JQL immediate docs

fields.description:
Similar to Jira Server (7.9+ ?), allow the admin to set an instance-wide option to return no data (with a suitable message) if the JQL Query will return all issues for the client instance.

 

(Optionally, allow each user to select.)
fields.summary: Option to Return no data on Empty JQL

fields.description:
*Problem Definition:*

Currently, users will require an account in order to access Private dashboards

 

*Suggested Solution:*

Be able to create a dashboard that wasn't public, but didn't need an account to access it

For example. 

A customer's situation was :

"We have multiple teams in the office (app devs, data engineers, exc...),
they all use different projects, but we wanted a communal board to be
displayed on a TV that can be seen by all of us, to be constantly
displaying Jira Statistics and high priority tasks. However, we don't want
to have a user constantly logged in for this, due to a) possibly getting
logged out due to inactivity, and b) we don't want to take up one of the
users in our Jira Plan for simply this"

 

*Workaround* 

None
fields.summary: Allow a private dashboard to be accessed by unlicensed users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Improve the Backup & Restore for instances that will be used as a sandbox.

Ideally, we would NOT have to:
# Re-install apps.
# Re-enable Product Access for all groups, which would force Dev instance into a paid tier. So then we had to disable access after re-installing apps.
# Re-license all apps. (This is a tricky one, I realize. It would require you to offer Cloud Development licenses that behave like Server Development licenses, which App licenses can then match with: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Marketplace-Apps-Integrations/Development-License-for-Jira-Addons/qaq-p/1105985)
fields.summary: Restoring Backup to Jira Cloud should have an option to include Apps, to create a usable Development/Staging environment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Connect Addons can overwrite system fields, which causes order by system field to fail JQL.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install connect addon that has Issue Property defined with key as index alias.
 # Run JQL `order by key`

h3. Expected Results

3. Jira returns issues ordered by system field issue key
h3. Actual Results

4. Jira breaks, doesn't return any issues, displays error
h3. Workaround

Uninstall add on with problematic Issue Property.
fields.summary: Stop Connect addons being able to break JQL sorting

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sometimes the name of the projects and fields are bigger than the size of the field, so it gets cut.

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to resize the fields.
fields.summary: Ability to resize fields in Jira create issue view

fields.description:
Would it possible to have Rich text format like this right now when creating a new issue in Jira cloud?

Right now we would create the issue and then goto the issue to write in RichText mode.
fields.summary: Rich text format when creating new issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The External System import for Jira Cloud has a question mark icon in the top right of the page, that is intended to take you to Atlassian's online documentation of how this importer functions.   The page you can see this on is:
example.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa

If you click the link it takes you to:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+Other+Issue+Trackers

Which currently redirects to
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/migrating-from-other-issue-trackers-861253679.html

The problem with this is that Jira 7.3 has importer options that have not been possible in Jira Cloud for months or years (Bugzilla importer, redmine importer, asana importer, etc)

It would be much better if this link just took admins to a page such as https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/migrating-from-other-issue-trackers-884344525.html


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Goto the external system importer as a Jira admin, URL /secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa
 # Click the ? in the top right to get help with documentation

h3. Expected Results
Takes you to documentation about Jira Cloud importer options


h3. Actual Results
Takes you to Jira Server 7.3 documentation that doesn't apply in most cases.

h3. Workaround
Admin will have to manually find the correct documentation that applies to his/her platform, such as https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/migrating-from-other-issue-trackers-884344525.html in the case of Jira Cloud admins that need help here.
fields.summary: Clicking the Get Online Help (?) icon in the External System Import page takes you to a Jira Server documentation page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The two-dimensional gadget has just added the field Epic Link. However, the Next-Gen Epic Link or "Parent" is not included. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the two-dimensional Gadget and select Epic Link in any of the columns.
 # Select a Filter that includes Next-Gen Issues. 
 # Jira shows None for all issues. 

h3. Expected Results

Jira should group the issues by "Parent" in Next Gen Issues similar case with Epic Link in Classic.
h3. Actual Results
Jira Shows None no matter we have an Epic Relation in Next-Gen Project. 
 !image-2020-02-04-16-49-19-715.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-02-04-16-50-07-383.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Gadget with Epic Link doesn't work in Next-Gen Projects

fields.description:
Using *.* or *gg* to launch the quick actions in an issue using the new issue view does not show the issue actions (e.g., *Delete*), but does when using the old issue view for the same issue.

The options are available in the new issue view when clicking on the *...* button in the upper right hand corner of the issue to show that menu though.
fields.summary: Issue actions in Quick actions menu not present for new issue view

fields.description: I want to create a link to an issue when creating issues by email.
fields.summary: Add Link to an Issue when created by email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When having [self-sign enabled for a specific domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/site-access-settings-improvements-979412810.html] in your site, users that have permission to administer projects can invite new users from those domains within the people section of a project which is expected.

The problem here is that this is not respected on business projects as the invitation fails without a valid error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Approve access to a domain.
 # With a user that has admin access on a project or a site-admin, navigate to the people section of a business project and try to invite a new user from the domain used earlier.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be invited and added to the role you were associating him with.

h3. Actual Results

The below error is thrown:
 !Image 2020-02-04 at 6.04.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 

In the browser calls we can see the POST to invite the user fails with a 400:
{code}
Request URL:https://{instance}.atlassian.net/rest/internal/2/invite-user/project/{projectId}
Request method:POST
Status code: 400

Response:
{"errorMessages":["We couldn't add user@domain.com. Check your network connection, then give it another try."],"errors":{}}
{code}

h3. Notes 

The same behavior is not noticed in software projects.

h3. Workaround

Have a site-admin invite the user and add him to the business project later.
fields.summary: Can't invite users from people section on business projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The reporter field is displaying add-on users in the user picker list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue;
 # Try to update the reporter.

_In the new issue view it appears as suggested_;
_In the old issue view, if the user is searched, it is also displayed_.

h3. Expected Results

Only non-add-on users will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

Add-on users are displayed.
!Image 2020-02-04 at 5.58.10 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Reporter field is displaying add-on users in the user picker list

fields.description:
*Problem*

In the old issue view, the comments order was configurable in *Jira > Jira Settings > System > General configuration > Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order*. In the new issue view, this setting doesn't work.

*Suggested resolution*

Ability to choose which order the comments will have in the issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to change comment order (newest at top VS newest at bottom) in the new issue view

fields.description: We are creating 2-3 *next-gen* projects a month. In every new project we have to set the issue types, the fields visible in these issue types and features. That is counter productive and it wastes from 30 do 60 minutes a month and makes the whole process prone to mistakes. It would be great if we could save project settings as default or at least DUPLICATE project. That would save us a lot of time.
fields.summary: As the Administrator, I want to configure default fields and project settings

fields.description:
Consider an issue with status - NEW and as per the workflow next status is IN PROGRESS

Now say user 1 and user 2 both try to make a transition from *NEW => IN PROGRESS*
One of the user will succeed in making the issue transition and the other user is actually calling the transition unknowingly from IN PROGRESS TO IN PROGRESS. It would be great if we could add a window refresh logic to avoid such situations.

In the user's word:

{code}
If somebody changed a status of an issue, and after that he/she will try to run the same transition on another browser page by Kanban Dashboard (like in video), and because of that a transition from another status will be called, and a user who tries to do that wouldn't expect to run the transition from another status.
{code}
fields.summary: Same transition performed on an issue concurrently

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

Sharing an issue from the old issue view is not triggering the desired email notification to the users the issue was shared with.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue in old issue view
 # Share the issue to yourself or another user email address. Refer below screenshot:

!Screenshot 2020-02-04 at 9.55.08 PM.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Expected Results

You or the user receive an email request when you share the issue with the required details.
h3. Actual Results 

Email is not received.
h3. Workaround

 The *Issue share* feature is working fine in the _new issue view_
fields.summary: Sharing an issue from the old issue view is not sending an email anymore

fields.description:
The following information is not available in this documentation, It would be great to have this information visible.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/adding-editing-and-deleting-a-custom-field-776636410.html
fields.summary: 404: Page not found ( Custom Field Jira Cloud)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per summary, the accountId used for user mention is currently breaking user mentions in new JIRA issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Mention a username twice in a comment in old JIRA issue view. 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 # Save the changes. In old JIRA issue view the username displays even though there are different between the user mentions (one is 'id' and the other is 'Id').
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 # Now change to new JIRA issue view. New JIRA issue view displays mention with 'accountid' without problems but mention using 'accountId' does not show properly.
 !screenshot-1 (1).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

New JIRA issue view should support both 'accountid' and 'accountId'.

h3. Actual Results

New JIRA issue view only supports 'accountid'.

h3. Workaround

Disable new JIRA issue view by disabling Atlassian Labs at https://<atlassian-domain>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa .
fields.summary: Inconsistency of user mention accountid casing breaks new JIRA issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Create Issue" permission for "Reporter" or "Current assignee" grants users to see the project name in create issue screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a permission scheme with:
** limited "Browse Project" permission
** "Create Issue" permission is set to "Reporter" or "Current assignee"
# Log in as a user who do not have the browse project permission
# Click the plus icon from the sidebar to create an issue
# Click the project dropdown

h3. Expected Results
The project with limited "Browse Project" permission won't show up

h3. Actual Results
The project with limited "Browse Project" permission will show up
 
h3. Workaround
Remove the "Reporter" and/or "Current assignee" from the permission scheme
fields.summary: "Create Issue" permission for "Reporter" or "Current assignee" grants users to see the project name in create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-4704].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz at atlassian dot com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

Current Custom Fields do not allow CF to be individually configured. For example, one might want a User Picker custom field to be limited to users of a particular group.

You should be able to pass in parameters to configure the custom field when you set it up initially.
fields.summary: Configurable Custom Fields

fields.description: Currently, cards in Jira don't display the whole title of a card if it's too long - you have to hover over the card to display the full title. It would be great to have this fully displayed.
fields.summary: Display full title on a card without having to hover over it

fields.description: Availability to change the site icons when you manage more than one site
fields.summary: Availability to change the site icons
Add markdown support for task lists

fields.description:
Would like to suggest the following Jira Cloud Filter Column selection addition
*Parent* (number with link)

This would be helpful on filters that include all types of issues, where sub-tasks all on the same Parent Task or Story would become visible (ability to group by Parent.)

In addition, would like to see the Parent field be the Epic # / Link on Filter items that are Stories.
fields.summary: Filter Column Additions Suggested

fields.description:
So where there is a due by date on an issue, bug or whatever there should be an automatic report that flags up anything that has gone over its due date; think this should go to the report, the assignee and any watchers.  My colleague found a link about this going back to 2006 and yet it doesn't seem to have been implemented.

 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9201
fields.summary: flagging for overdue dates.....

fields.description:
We currently use both JIRA Cloud and JIRA Server and I am having quite some difficulty managing the scope of active sprints (in BOTH).

I have been through the rounds of communication and education but still have a discipline problem.  This specifically relates to scope changes in active sprints.  I am finding the support in JIRA sadly inadequate.

I need our Product Owners (we have three - It is a large project) to be able to manage future sprints but they should not change In Flight sprints.

I see two options:

1) Only the PO's and the SM can add issues to sprints.  I would like to be able to further restrict additions to In-Flight sprints to the SM only, that would ensure a conversation happens before the scope is changed (this is my preferred solution).

2) JIRA should be able to notify the SM if the scope of the active sprint is changed.  This could be used to provoke the conversation AFTER THE FACT.

To be honest, it is pretty shocking that there is no real support for managing active sprints in this way.  It's almost like nobody uses JIRA in the wild!
fields.summary: Sprint Management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

On the new issue view, in the "Activity" section, the tabs available do not include the "All" option:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  
While on the old issue view, there is a tab "All" that displays comments, history etc:   !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
This is not available on the new issue view. 

h3. Suggestion

Provide the "All" tab option on the new issue view as well. This helps in reading through the comments and history information on issues instead of having to switch through between sections.
fields.summary: "All" tab option missing from new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Recently, without any changes , some issue type avatar/icon are broken. From the network logs , it return 404 error code meaning *Oops, you've found a dead link.*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the issue type configuration page
 # You will notice there's a few issue type avatar are broken

h3. Expected Results
All avatar/icon display
h3. Actual Results
Issue type avatar/icon broken :-
 !Screenshot 2020-02-02 at 2.34.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-02-02 at 2.34.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Reconfigure again the issue type avatar/icon at https://xxxx.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa
fields.summary: Issue type avatar/icon broken in the UI and return 404 error in the network log
Issue colector not working when Account field is required
